Detailed Description

Mainboards Page representation.

Contains all the elements forming the Mainboards page.

Mainboards stored in database are listed here. Saved Mainboard configurations can be viewed and deleted. Also it can be checked how a Mainboard is supported by a selected Operating System.

An instance is created to show the page in each time, and instance is deleted when browsing to another page.

Definition at line 35 of file mainboards.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MainboardsWidget::MainboardsWidget ( Wt::WContainerWidget *  parent  )  [private]

Constructor.

Private to accept calls just from Instance() function. This way creation of MainboardsWidget objects with direct calls to constructor is rejected.

Create the layout of page and set source models for mainboards selection box and OS combo boxes.

Parameters:
parent Parent container of MainboardsWidget instance.

void MainboardsWidget::bCheckOs_Click (  )  [private]

Triggered on 'Check' button click.

Called on bCheckOs_ button click event.

Get the list of PCI Devices belonging to the selected mainboard and switch to the PcimapResultWidget providing Device List, Mainboard name and OS name. Which will result in an additional Support column in PcimapResultWidget::lspciTable_ showing if the device at line is supported by passed OS.

Definition at line 565 of file mainboards.cc.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void MainboardsWidget::bDeleteBoard_Click (  )  [private]

Triggered on 'Delete' button click.

Ask user for confirmation of deletion with dialogWarn_ window and bind the dialog window to dialogWarn_Close() function on close event.

Definition at line 323 of file mainboards.cc.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void MainboardsWidget::deleteBoard (  )  [private]

Delete the selected mainboard.

First get the ID of selected mainboard, then delete the mainboard from database calling function deleteBoardModel(). Display dialogWarn_ about success status, and finally refresh the page.

Definition at line 354 of file mainboards.cc.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void MainboardsWidget::dialogWarn_Close ( Wt::WDialog::DialogCode  code  )  [private]

Triggered on mainboard delete confirmation dialog close.

Depending on code value:

  • WDialog::Accepted
    User confirmed deletion of mainboard, so call deleteBoard() function.
  • WDialog::Rejected
    Do nothing.
Parameters:
code dialogWarn_ close status; WDialog::Accepted or WDialog::Rejected.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void MainboardsWidget::fillKernelModel ( std::string  release_id  )  [private]

Fill in the kernelModel_.

Retrieve list of Kernels of a Release(Unique Kernel ID - Kernel version/arch) with passed Release ID, and put them in kernelModel_.

Parameters:
release_id ID of a Distribution Release.
Warning:
Unique Kernel ID, means a unique ID for each OS(Distribution-Release-Kernel all together) in database.

std::vector< PciDevice > MainboardsWidget::getBoardDeviceList ( std::string  board_id  )  [private]

Retrieve list of devices for the mainboard with passed ID.

First query Unique IDs of the devices belonging to the mainboard. Then get their codes and make list of PciDevice's.

Parameters:
board_id ID of Mainboard to query it's devices.
Returns:
List of PCI Devices.

std::string MainboardsWidget::getBoardIdentifier (  )  [private]

Retrieve selected Mainboard's ID.

Get index of mainboard currently selected in boardsSelection_ by mapping it's index to boardsProxyModel_ on column 0(holding IDs) and consecutively mapping it to mainboards_ to get the selected mainboard's ID.

Returns:
ID of selected Mainboard.

Retrieve the selected OS's Unique ID in ComboBoxes.

Returns:
An ID representing the selected OS from ComboBoxes.

void MainboardsWidget::osSelectionChanged ( int  selected_index  )  [private]

Triggered on selection change of comboOS_.

If an OS Distribution is selected, then calls fillReleaseModel() function with selected distribution ID.

Parameters:

void MainboardsWidget::showBoardConfiguration ( std::string  board_id  )  [private]

Switch to PcimapResultWidget to display mainboard configuration.

Retrieve PCI devices belonging to the mainboard with ID = board_id. And switch to Query Devices Result page and delete current instance of MainboardsWidget.

Parameters:
board_id ID of Mainboard to be displayed.

Definition at line 270 of file mainboards.hpp.

Wt::WSortFilterProxyModel* MainboardsWidget::boardsProxyModel_ [private]

Source for Mainboards selection box.

This proxy model does not store data itself, but presents data from a source model(in this case it's mainboards_). It allows sorting and filtering of the source model data without actually altering the source model.

Source model for boardsSelection_.

Definition at line 86 of file mainboards.hpp.

Wt::WSelectionBox* MainboardsWidget::boardsSelection_ [private]

Selection box of Mainboards.

Provides a list box with single selection holding list of mainboards. Uses boardsProxyModel_ as it's source.

Wt::WDialog* MainboardsWidget::dialogWarn_ [private]

Dialog window used for confirmation of delete and success/failure status.

Used for two purposes:

  • Ask user for confirmation of mainboard deletion.
  • Display success or failure of mainboard deletion.
See also:

Definition at line 66 of file mainboards.hpp.

Wt::WStandardItemModel* MainboardsWidget::mainboards_ [private]

Source for boardsProxyModel_ holding stored mainboards.

This model is filled from the mainboard_list_. Column 0 of model is holding the mainboard IDs from database and column 1 is holding the name of mainboards.

See also:
fillMainboards().
